title: Royal Enfield Slide School Cup concludes its first edition
description: Royal Enfield concluded its first edition of the Slide School Cup at Jaipur’s recently introduced Royal Enfield track. The flat-track racing event spanned over three months and hosted over a hundred participants across Goa, Bengaluru, Pune and Jaipur.  A victory in the final round’s third race secures Anish Shetty the championship win Sathya Raj Arumugam becomes first runner-up; Karan Drishya finishes third  Royal Enfield Slide School Cup: what is it? Flat-tracking is an extreme American motorsport and is possibly the oldest form of motorcycle racing in existence. For those uninitiated with the Royal Enfield Slide School, it first debuted in India in 2019 at Rider Mania. Since then, it has marked its presence in various countries, including the US, the UK and Thailand and those in Europe.  The Royal Enfield Slide School Cup is an extension of the pre-existing Slide School. It aims to encourage Slide School students to participate in this championship. This was the inaugural edition, and it began at the Motoverse 2024, with riders competing with an FT411 motorcycle purpose-built for flat-track. The championship concluded with a tie between Anish Shetty and Sathya Raj Arumugam, with 39 points each. However, Shetty was announced as the champion as he won the third race of the final round. Arumugam was adjudged the first runner-up, and Karan Drishya was the second runner-up with 29 points. The Jaipur track, located on the city’s outskirts, will be used for rider training through the brand’s Adventure School and Slide School programmes, besides being a training ground for the brand’s factory teams. The premises are divided into four activity areas, namely Adventure Zone, Slide Zone, Technical Zone and Chill Zone.  Also see: Going Slideways: Royal Enfield Slide School Experience Royal Enfield Shotgun 650 Icon Edition launched at Rs 4.25 lakh

The event spanned over three months and hosted over a hundred participants.

Royal Enfield concluded its first edition of the Slide School Cup at Jaipur’s recently introduced Royal Enfield track. The flat-track racing event spanned over three months and hosted over a hundred participants across Goa, Bengaluru, Pune and Jaipur. 

  1. A victory in the final round’s third race secures Anish Shetty the championship win
  2. Sathya Raj Arumugam becomes first runner-up; Karan Drishya finishes third 

Royal Enfield Slide School Cup: what is it?

Flat-tracking is an extreme American motorsport and is possibly the oldest form of motorcycle racing in existence. For those uninitiated with the Royal Enfield Slide School, it first debuted in India in 2019 at Rider Mania. Since then, it has marked its presence in various countries, including the US, the UK and Thailand and those in Europe. 

The Royal Enfield Slide School Cup is an extension of the pre-existing Slide School. It aims to encourage Slide School students to participate in this championship. This was the inaugural edition, and it began at the Motoverse 2024, with riders competing with an FT411 motorcycle purpose-built for flat-track.

The championship concluded with a tie between Anish Shetty and Sathya Raj Arumugam, with 39 points each. However, Shetty was announced as the champion as he won the third race of the final round. Arumugam was adjudged the first runner-up, and Karan Drishya was the second runner-up with 29 points.

The Jaipur track, located on the city’s outskirts, will be used for rider training through the brand’s Adventure School and Slide School programmes, besides being a training ground for the brand’s factory teams. The premises are divided into four activity areas, namely Adventure Zone, Slide Zone, Technical Zone and Chill Zone.
